snippet: A New Jersey broker’s stock-trading software accidentally set off millions of trades on Wednesday, drawing renewed attention to the fragility of the nation’s stock exchanges.
abstract: Stock-trading software from New Jersey broker Knight Capital Group accidentally sets off millions of trades, drawing renewed attention to the fragility of the nation’s stock exchanges; after early surge in volume, stocks settle down and recover.

byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced and Ben Protess contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A New Jersey broker’s stock-trading software accidentally set off millions of trades on Wednesday, drawing renewed attention to the fragility of the nation’s stock exchanges.

headline.seo: Wave of Volatile Trading Unsettles U.S. Markets
headline.main: Flood of Errant Trades Is a Black Eye for Wall Street
headline.print_headline: Runaway Trades Spread Turmoil Across Wall St.
